image.altText: Man in beanie on yacht

props.synopsis: A South Australian man is being remembered as a "down-to-earth" and 'experienced' sailor after he died onboard a vessel in the Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

title.children: SA man who died in Sydney to Hobart remembered as 'down-to-earth sailor'

image.altText: Supermarket fire

props.synopsis: All charges have been dropped against two teenagers originally accused of starting a fire at a popular shopping centre in the Adelaide Hills causing $25 million worth of damage.

title.children: All charges dropped against teens over Stirling Woolworths fire

image.altText: A horse drawing a tram filled with people.

props.synopsis: After the death of their beloved Clydesdale Isabella, the iconic Victor Harbor horse-drawn tram is gearing up for a busy summer. There are several new equine faces on the team, including a Golden Plough winner and a horse afraid of puddles.

title.children: Tourist town's beloved horse-drawn tram ready for summer after heartache

image.altText: Chelsea, Demi and Joel Holloway stand together holding up shirts and revealing their surgery scars on abdomen.

props.synopsis: Three Adelaide siblings say their lives have changed forever after undergoing pancreas removal — and they're wearing their scars with pride.

title.children: 'Ticking time bomb': Adelaide siblings undergo rare procedure to remove their pancreas

image.altText: A woman holding a card

props.synopsis: Noela Hellyer will gather with family and friends today to celebrate her 100th birthday, with the focus on her this time rather than Christmas.

title.children: Noela to finally get birthday party of her own on 100th Christmas Day

image.altText: Dry grass with CFS truck and residents leaning over fences with hoses

props.synopsis: Residents could be seen leaning over their back fences with garden hoses as they tried to stop fire spreading to their properties as Adelaide swelters through hot and dangerous conditions.

title.children: Christmas lunch abandoned as grassfire threatens homes in Adelaide's north

image.altText: An elderly couple hold and look on at photos of the aftermath of Cyclone Tracy

props.synopsis: Retired policeman Terry Ey and his wife Rosemary took up a posting in Darwin just before Christmas in 1974. They reflect on the terror and aftermath of one of Australia's worst ever natural disasters.

title.children: Fifty years after Cyclone Tracy, a family remembers the eye of the storm

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled the body of a teenager — whose death is being investigated as murder — be cremated against his mother's wishes.

title.children: Court orders murdered teenager be cremated against his mother's wishes

image.altText: Virat Kohli walking off the MCG, looking sad after being dismissed, as Australia celebrate behind

props.synopsis: India suffers a disaster late on day two of the Boxing Day Test, with Yashasvi Jaiswal run out for 82 in a mix-up with Virat Kohli, who nicks off immediately after.

title.children: Virat Kohli again at the centre of late Indian drama on day two at MCG

image.altText: A close up of a blonde woman's face

props.synopsis: In a social media ecosystem already rife with misogyny, racism and aggression, experts say it's remarkably easy to shape the narrative around a public figure through "astroturfing".

title.children: Blake Lively is not the first star to allegedly be targeted by 'astroturfing'

image.altText: musician Kim Deal plays a black electric guitar and sings while wearing a designer jacket with planets, stars and shapes.

props.synopsis: After nearly 40 years, alt-rock icon Kim Deal is finally releasing a full solo album. She discusses opening for Olivia Rodrigo and the loss of her mother and her friend and collaborator, Steve Albini.

title.children: At 63, Pixies and Breeders co-founder Kim Deal releases first solo album

image.altText: Busy Main Beach at Noosa in January 2022

props.synopsis: Summer is a bumper time of year for coastal communities, but not every town is happy with the influx of holiday crowds as pollution, traffic and waste put a strain on local infrastructure.

title.children: 'They use the bush as a toilet': Beach towns struggling with overtourism

image.altText: Business meeting

props.synopsis: "Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely." Those words, penned by Lord Acton in the 19th century have never been more salient for corporate Australia.

title.children: Power without glory: The ties between 2024’s biggest business scandals

image.altText: A drone view shows the crash site of an Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane near the city of Aktau

props.synopsis: An Azerbaijan Airlines flight that crashed in Kazakhstan was downed by a Russian air defence system, four sources in Azerbaijan with knowledge of the investigation say.

title.children: Sources claim Azerbaijan Airlines flight downed by Russian air defence system

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: One of Australia's closest neighbours proposes 29 locations for nuclear power plants across the archipelago, but critics say the plan is "dangerous".

title.children: Concerns over Indonesia's nuclear power plans as 29 sites proposed

image.altText: new york yellow taxi front end smashed and police tape covering the scene

props.synopsis: A total of seven people were reportedly injured in the incident that occurred outside a Macy's department store in midtown Manhattan.

title.children: Two Australians reportedly injured after New York taxi veers into pedestrians

image.altText: A man greeting the crowd.

props.synopsis: India's former prime minister Manmohan Singh, widely regarded as the architect of India's economic reform program and a landmark nuclear deal with the United States, dies at the age of 92.

title.children: India's former prime minister Manmohan Singh dies aged 92

image.altText: A white van with red letters reading "PRESS" on its back doors, browned and covered in smoke, with two people standing nearby

props.synopsis: Israel's National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir visited Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Thursday, sparking condemnation from the Palestinian Authority and Jordan.

title.children: Five Palestinian journalists reportedly killed in Gaza air strikes

image.altText: Yellow signs on the glass door of a bottle shop saying CLOSED

props.synopsis: A US election, an unprecedented tech outage, and living the Italian dream. 2024 was also the year multiple tragedies gripped the nation.

title.children: A US election, a global tech outage and the Italian dream: The most read ABC News stories of 2024

image.altText: Finland's white and blue border coast guard ship on a dark sea in front of the a black oil tanker

props.synopsis: The Nordic country's National Bureau of Investigation says the ship is suspected of towing an anchor that caused damage to a source of electricity powering Estonia.

title.children: Finland seizes tanker suspected of causing underwater power cable outage

image.altText: Images of an elderly woman wearing a white shirt, holding her phone as she sits at her kitchen table. Her face is hidden.

props.synopsis: With millions of dollars lost in NSW alone, one investigator says it's often the family of romance fraud victims who reach out for support on their behalf.

title.children: '$400,000 gone': NSW residents fall victim to dating scam 'master manipulators'

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market ends the day higher on its first day back after the Christmas break, despite a mediocre session on Wall Street. Take a look back at how things unfolded.

title.children: ASX closes higher after mixed session on Wall Street — as it happened

image.altText: A group of people running out of a boardered off area.

props.synopsis: Police say protests at the prison led to the collapse of a wall which allowed the inmates to flee.

title.children: At least 6,000 prisoners escape maximum security prison in Mozambique

image.altText: Two people in beds in an Afghan hospital hooked up to drips.

props.synopsis: Bombardment by Pakistani military aircraft in Afghanistan's eastern Paktika province kills at least 46 people, most of whom are children and women, according to the Taliban.

title.children: Taliban vows retribution after Pakistani air strikes kill 46 people

image.altText: Colonel Sanders statue dressed as Santa Claus outside a KFC in Japan

props.synopsis: If you're looking for something to do after Christmas, never fear the weekly news quiz is here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Festive drug bust, return of feathered foe and KFC Christmas

image.altText: Sara Netanyahu smiling while facing toward her left and wearing a white top with black collar and buttons

props.synopsis: Allegations have surfaced that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's wife called for protests against political opponents and the intimidation of a key witness in the corruption probe against him.

title.children: Investigation ordered into claims Sara Netanyahu harassed opponents

image.altText: Braden Harrison

props.synopsis: Finding spaces for artists to exhibit work in a major city is expensive, but one creative initiative is re-imagining empty shop fronts.

title.children: Empty shop fronts repurposed as art galleries amid property crunch

image.altText: An aerial view of a town

props.synopsis: There are calls for the Northern Territory to scrap a tiered building system that makes it legal to build a home that fails to meet national safety and liveability standards. And a housing expert says it wouldn't cost much to make the change.

title.children: In the remote NT there's no legal requirement to build houses to code

image.altText: Illustration of boats in a harbour, with small village on hill behind, circa 1800.

props.synopsis: When Senator Lidia Thorpe shouted to King Charles that "this is not your land" she highlighted the issue of theft, and Australia's very complicated history with it.

title.children: In a world of disadvantage and exploitation, is stealing always wrong?

image.altText: Influencer Tim Abbott takes a selfie while lying on the sand at the beach on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: We share some tips from influencer Tim Abbott, along with several other people we have spoken to as part of our Unwind with... series, about switching off digitally these holidays.

title.children: How to switch off digitally these holidays to be present

image.altText: jet skis and divers search for a missing boy at North Avoca Beach

props.synopsis: Police say it is unlikely a 15-year-old boy will be found alive after he was swept into the sea from rocks on the NSW Central Coast on Christmas Eve.

title.children: Family's anguish as search for 'perfect son' becomes a recovery operation

image.altText: A a silver SUV and police car parked outside a two-story house, which is cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with murder over the death of a woman in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged with murder of woman in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Joel Embiid, right, argues with referee Jenna Schroeder

props.synopsis: Philadelphia 76ers star Joel Embiid was ejected from his NBA game against the San Antonio Spurs, and reacted angrily towards official Jenna Schroeder.

title.children: Joel Embiid thrown out of NBA game for contact with female official

image.altText: A woman in a khaki button-down wiping off the leaves of a palm in a tropical greenhouse.

props.synopsis: For about two hours every week, the Squishy Vols, as they're known, meet for some meditative manual labour to squish bugs and scrape scale from plants in the glasshouses at the Australian National Botanic Gardens in Canberra.

title.children: Volunteers search for pests in bid to preserve treasured Australian plants
